Initial SetupÂ¶

Below are the steps to install and setup the package.

  1. Pull the package from the github repo via:

    git clone https://github.com/wirrell/FAW

  2. Make a virtual environment to install the requirements (docs at https://docs.python.org/3/library/venv.html):

    python3 -m venv faw_env

  3. Activate the virtual environment via:

    source faw_env/bin/activate

  4. Now navigate into the module and install the requirements using pip via:

    cd FAW
pip install -r requirements.txt

  5. Next, add the module to the pythonpath. This must be done so that the module can be imported and import itself via the standard import {package} syntax used in Python. I recommend doing this by going into the virtual environment directory at faw_env/lib64/python3.6/site-packages and add a file name faw.pth which contains a single line that is the path to the package e.g.:

    /home/user/Documents/FAW

  6. Now you can edit the config.json file and modify the training_dir, validation_dir, and working_model (where the model to be loaded by the classifier will be stored).

  7. You can now edit the other parameters and run the train_model.py script in the training dir to train a model before moving it in to your working model directory. The FAW package will now load the trained model when it is called upon to run a classification.
